title: American_Top_40_1982_January_16th
description:
"You're hearing the 40 top tunes in the fifty states, I'm Casey Kasem"


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

There is a song that took its title from, and was inspired by, a 1948 movie about gangsters hiding out in a Florida hotel and caught in the middle of a hurricane.

A listener wants to know, "What song in all of chart history has hit number one in the most different versions?"  Casey tells about the three songs that hit number one as original hits, and then again as remakes. Then he tells about the champ which is a song that hit number one by three different artists - all in a seven week period - back in the summer of 1946.

Casey answers the question, "What male and female solo artists in the rock era have had the most hits in the top 40 at the same time?" For the female artist, there is a three-way tie between Gail, Melanie, and Diana.

Casey retells how Bob Eubanks (host of the Newlywed Game and last week's guest-host of AT40) once turned down the chance to manage a superstar in this countdown, and then plays him one of her number 1 songs as an extra.

There is a band in the countdown that got signed to play The Ed Sullivan Show after they ambushed Ed Sullivan himself on vacation in Cannes, just to come back to the states and find the show cancelled.

LW#3: Let's Groove - Earth, Wind & Fire
LW#2: Waiting For A Girl Like You - Foreigner
